result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark J Roou was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus the $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--not to raise his voice at Ms. Kari Behling
--not to throw any objects at Ms. Kari Behling or within her general proximity
--not to call Ms. Behling any profane or derogative names
--not to make any financial decisions on behalf of Ms. Kari Behling without her and the agents approval
--Kari Behling and Mr. Roou are only to live together with approval by agent 

Arresting Agency: JCSD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

05-04-2015 - The Court orders the Judgment of Conviciton be amended to reflect that the victims name is Kari Behling. The amended Judgment will replace the name Connie Behling with Kari Behling.

The Court orders the Judgment of Conviciton be amended to reflect that the victims name is Kari Behling. The amended Judgment will replace the name Connie Behling with Kari Behling.
Proposed Stipulation and Order to Amend Judgment of Conviction to Correct Scrivener's Error
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 4:08pm [mo]
Defendant Mark J Roou in court with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

 Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Statement made by victim, Ms.  Connie Behling
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Roou

The Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--not to raise his voice at Ms. Connie Behling
--not to throw any objects at Ms. Connie Behling or within her general proximity
--not to call Ms. Behling any profane or derogative names
--not to make any financial decisions on behalf of Ms. Connie Behling without her and the agents approval
--Connie Behling and Mr. Roou are only to live together with approval by agent 
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus the $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  3  days
recess: 4:31pm
Status conference on March 16, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on March 16, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Case called at 8:38[Clerk MO]
Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell appears in Court.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Mark Roou DOES NOT appear.
The Court indicates todays hearing was scheduled for a status conference.
Atty. Zarwell indicates he his currently serving a huber sanction in the Jefferson County Jail. He is currently in Madison at a doctor's appointment, he mis calendared today's hearing. 
The Court adjourns the Status Conference.
The State verifies victim right compliance.

recess: 8:40am

NEXT: Adjourned Status Conference 3/16/15 at 3:30pm
State's with cover letter
Bond signed on 1-16-15 and received by COC on 1-20-15
Attorney Yelena Zarwell
Jury trial on April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on April 6, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 4, 2015 at 11:00 am.
The jail was called because the bond for the defendant had not been received by our office. I was advised he is on a PO hold so added Jefferson County jail as other address
Probable Cause Statement
Scheduling Notice

case called at 1:  pm. [MK]
Defendant Mark J. Roou appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Zarwell (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Mr. Roou verifies that the date of birth and address on the Criminal Complaint are accurate.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires a $1,500  signature bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Kari Behling except through attorneys
--no presence at W5763 Creamery Road in Fort Atkinson
--no acts or threats of violence
--to provide a new mailing address to the Clerk of Courts Office by 4:30pm on January 16, 2015 
recess 1:45pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 2/4/15 at 11:00am  (2) FSSC on 4/6/15 at 11:00am. (3) Jury Trial on 4/9/15 at 8:30aStatus Conference to be scheduled after the Pretrial date
